00021 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::initialize(int stage)
00022 {
00023   BaseNetwLayer::initialize(stage);
00024 
00025   if(stage == 0){
00026       stats = par("stats");
00027       trace = par("trace");
00028       debug = par("debug");
00029       broadcastPeriod = par("bcperiod");
00030       beta = par("beta");
00031       maxNbBcast = par("maxNbBcast");
00032       headerLength = par("headerLength");
00033       timeInQueueAfterDeath = par("timeInQueueAfterDeath");
00034       timeToLive = par("timeToLive");
00035       broadcastTimer = new cMessage("broadcastTimer");
00036       maxFirstBcastBackoff = par("maxFirstBcastBackoff");
00037       oneHopLatencies.setName("oneHopLatencies");
00038       nbDataPacketsReceived = 0;
00039       nbDataPacketsSent = 0;
00040       debugNbMessageKnown = 0;
00041       nbDataPacketsForwarded = 0;
00042       nbHops = 0;
00043   }
00044 }
00045 
00046 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::handleUpperMsg(cMessage* msg)
00047 {
00048   ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* pkt;
00049 
00050   // encapsulate message in a network layer packet.
00051   pkt = static_cast<ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt*>(encapsMsg(static_cast<cPacket*>(msg)));
00052   nbDataPacketsSent++;
00053   EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " handleUpperMsg(): Pkt ID = " << pkt->getId() << " TTL = " << pkt->getAppTtl() << endl;
00054   // submit packet for first insertion in queue.
00055   insertNewMessage(pkt, true);
00056 }
00057 
00058 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::handleLowerMsg(cMessage* msg)
00059 {
00060   LAddress::L2Type macSrcAddr;
00061   ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* m     = check_and_cast<ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt*>(msg);
00062   cObject*                   cInfo = m->removeControlInfo();
00063   m->setNbHops(m->getNbHops()+1);
00064   macSrcAddr = MacToNetwControlInfo::getAddressFromControlInfo( cInfo );
00065   delete cInfo;
00066   ++nbDataPacketsReceived;
00067   nbHops = nbHops + m->getNbHops();
00068   if(trace) {
00069     oneHopLatencies.record(SIMTIME_DBL(simTime() - m->getTimestamp()));
00070   }
00071   // oneHopLatency gives us an estimate of how long the message spent in the MAC queue of
00072   // its sender (compared to that, transmission delay is negligible). Use this value
00073   // to update the TTL of the message. Dump it if it is dead.
00074   //m->setAppTtl(m->getAppTtl().dbl() - oneHopLatency);
00075   if (/*(m->getAppTtl() <= 0) || */(messageKnown(m->getId()))) {
00076     // we got this message already, ignore it.
00077     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " handleLowerMsg(): Dead or Known message ID=" << m->getId() << " from node "
00078        << macSrcAddr << " TTL = " << m->getAppTtl() << endl;
00079     delete m;
00080   }
00081   else {
00082     if (debugMessageKnown(m->getId())) {
00083       ++debugNbMessageKnown;
00084       EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " ERROR Message should be known TTL= " << m->getAppTtl() << endl;
00085     }
00086     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " handleLowerMsg(): Unknown message ID=" << m->getId() << " from node "
00087        << macSrcAddr << endl;
00088     // Unknown message. Insert message in queue with random backoff broadcast delay.
00089     // Because we got the message from lower layer, we need to create and add a new
00090     // control info with the MAC destination address = broadcast address.
00091     setDownControlInfo(m, LAddress::L2BROADCAST);
00092     // before inserting message, update source address (for this hop, not the initial source)
00093     m->setSrcAddr(myNetwAddr);
00094     insertNewMessage(m);
00095 
00096     // until a subscription mechanism is implemented, duplicate and pass all received packets
00097     // to the application layer who will be able to compute statistics.
00098     // TODO: implement an application subscription mechanism.
00099     if (true) {
00100       ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* mCopy = static_cast<ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt*>(m->dup());
00101       sendUp(decapsMsg(mCopy));
00102     }
00103   }
00104 }
00105 
00106 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::handleSelfMsg(cMessage* msg)
00107 {
00108   if (msg == broadcastTimer) {
00109     tMsgDesc* msgDesc;
00110     ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* pkt;
00111 
00112     // called method pops the first message from the message queue and
00113     // schedules the message timer for the next one. The message is embedded
00114     // into a container of type tMsgDesc.
00115     msgDesc = popFirstMessageUpdateQueue();
00116     pkt = msgDesc->pkt;
00117     // if the packet is alive, duplicate it and insert the copy in the queue,
00118     // then perform a broadcast attempt.
00119     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " handleSelfMsg(): Message ID= " << pkt->getId() << " TTL= " << pkt->getAppTtl() << endl;
00120     if (pkt->getAppTtl() > 0) {
00121       // check if we are allowed to re-transmit the message on more time.
00122       if (msgDesc->nbBcast < maxNbBcast) {
00123         ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* pktCopy;
00124         bool sendForSure = msgDesc->initialSend;
00125 
00126         // duplicate packet and insert the copy in the queue.
00127         // two possibilities: the packet will be alive at next
00128         // broadcast period => insert it with delay = broadcastPeriod.
00129         // Or the packet will be dead at next broadcast period (TTL <= broadcastPeriod)
00130         // => insert it with delay = TTL. So when the copy will be popped out of the
00131         // queue, it will be considered as dead and discarded.
00132         pktCopy = static_cast<ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt*>(pkt->dup());
00133         // control info is not duplicated with the message, so we have to re-create one here.
00134         setDownControlInfo(pktCopy, LAddress::L2BROADCAST);
00135         // it the copy that is re-inserted into the queue so update the container accordingly
00136         msgDesc->pkt = pktCopy;
00137         // increment nbBcast field of the descriptor because at this point, it is sure that
00138         // the message will go through one more broadcast attempt.
00139         msgDesc->nbBcast++;
00140         // for sure next broadcast attempt will not be the initial one.
00141         msgDesc->initialSend = false;
00142         // if msg TTL > broadcast period, the message will be broadcasted one more
00143         // time, insert it with delay = broadcast period. Otherwise, the message
00144         // will be dead at next broadcast attempt. Keep it in the list with
00145         // delay = TTL + timeInQueueAfterDeath. insertMessage() will update its
00146         // TTL to -timeInQueueAfterDeath, a negative value. That way, the message
00147         // is known to the system, de-synchronization between copies of the same message
00148         // is therefore handled and when the message will be popped out, its TTL will
00149         // be smaller than zero, thus the message will be discarded, not broadcasted.
00150         if (pktCopy->getAppTtl() > broadcastPeriod)
00151           insertMessage(broadcastPeriod, msgDesc);
00152         else
00153           insertMessage(pktCopy->getAppTtl()+timeInQueueAfterDeath, msgDesc);
00154         // broadcast the message with probability beta
00155         if (sendForSure) {
00156           EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "     Send packet down for sure." << endl;
00157           pkt->setTimestamp();
00158           sendDown(pkt);
00159           ++nbDataPacketsForwarded;
00160         }
00161         else {
00162           if (bernoulli(beta)) {
00163             EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "     Bernoulli test result: TRUE. Send packet down." << endl;
00164             pkt->setTimestamp();
00165             sendDown(pkt);
00166             ++nbDataPacketsForwarded;
00167           }
00168           else {
00169             EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "     Bernoulli test result: FALSE" << endl;
00170             delete pkt;
00171           }
00172         }
00173       }
00174       else {
00175         // we can't re-transmit the message because maxNbBcast is reached.
00176         // re-insert-it in the queue with delay = TTL so that its ID is still
00177         // known by the system.
00178         EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "     maxNbBcast reached." << endl;
00179         insertMessage(pkt->getAppTtl()+timeInQueueAfterDeath, msgDesc);
00180       }
00181     }
00182     else {
00183       EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "     Message TTL zero, discard." << endl;
00184       delete msgDesc;
00185       delete pkt;
00186     }
00187   }
00188   else {
00189     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " Received unexpected self message" << endl;
00190   }
00191 }

00193 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::handleLowerControl(cMessage* msg)
00194 {
00195   EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " Received lower control message. Name: "
00196      << msg->getName() << " type: " << msg->getKind() << endl;
00197   delete msg;
00198 }
00199 
00200 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::finish()
00201 {
00202   EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " finish()" << endl;
00203   cancelAndDelete(broadcastTimer);
00204   // if some messages are still in the queue, delete them.
00205   while (!msgQueue.empty()) {
00206     TimeMsgMap::iterator pos = msgQueue.begin();
00207     tMsgDesc* msgDesc = pos->second;
00208     msgQueue.erase(pos);
00209     delete msgDesc->pkt;
00210     delete msgDesc;
00211   }
00212   if (stats) {
00213     recordScalar("nbDataPacketsReceived", nbDataPacketsReceived);
00214     recordScalar("debugNbMessageKnown", debugNbMessageKnown);
00215     recordScalar("nbDataPacketsForwarded", nbDataPacketsForwarded);
00216     if(nbDataPacketsReceived > 0) {
00217       recordScalar("meanNbHops", (double) nbHops / (double) nbDataPacketsReceived);
00218     } else {
00219       recordScalar("meanNbHops", 0);
00220     }
00221   }
00222 }
00223 
00224 bool ProbabilisticBroadcast::messageKnown(unsigned int msgId)
00225 {
00226   MsgIdSet::iterator pos;
00227 
00228   pos = knownMsgIds.find(msgId);
00229   return pos != knownMsgIds.end();
00230 }
00231 
00232 bool ProbabilisticBroadcast::debugMessageKnown(unsigned int msgId)
00233 {
00234   MsgIdSet::iterator pos;
00235 
00236   pos = debugMsgIdSet.find(msgId);
00237   return pos != debugMsgIdSet.end();
00238 }
00239 
00240 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::insertMessage(simtime_t_cref bcastDelay, tMsgDesc* msgDesc)
00241 {
00242   TimeMsgMap::iterator pos;
00243   simtime_t bcastTime = simTime() + bcastDelay;
00244 
00245   EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "         insertMessage() bcastDelay = " << bcastDelay << " Msg ID = " << msgDesc->pkt->getId() << endl;
00246   // update TTL field of the message to the value it will have when taken out of the list
00247   msgDesc->pkt->setAppTtl(msgDesc->pkt->getAppTtl() - bcastDelay);
00248   // insert message ID in ID list.
00249   knownMsgIds.insert(msgDesc->pkt->getId());
00250   // insert key value pair <broadcast time, pointer to message> in message queue.
00251   pos = msgQueue.insert(make_pair(bcastTime, msgDesc));
00252   // if the message has been inserted in the front of the list, it means that it
00253   // will be the next message to be broadcasted, therefore we have to re-schedule
00254   // the broadcast timer to the message's broadcast instant.
00255   if (pos == msgQueue.begin()) {
00256     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "         message inserted in the front, reschedule it." << endl;
00257     cancelEvent(broadcastTimer);
00258     scheduleAt(bcastTime, broadcastTimer);
00259   }
00260 }
00261 
00262 ProbabilisticBroadcast::tMsgDesc* ProbabilisticBroadcast::popFirstMessageUpdateQueue(void)
00263 {
00264   TimeMsgMap::iterator pos;
00265   tMsgDesc* msgDesc;
00266 
00267   // get first message.
00268   ASSERT(!msgQueue.empty());
00269   pos = msgQueue.begin();
00270   msgDesc = pos->second;
00271   // remove first message from message queue and from ID list
00272   msgQueue.erase(pos);
00273   knownMsgIds.erase(msgDesc->pkt->getId());
00274   EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "         pop(): just popped msg " << msgDesc->pkt->getId() << endl;
00275   if (!msgQueue.empty()) {
00276     // schedule broadcast of new first message
00277     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << "         pop(): schedule next message." << endl;
00278     pos = msgQueue.begin();
00279     scheduleAt(pos->first, broadcastTimer);
00280   }
00281   return msgDesc;
00282 }
00283 
00284 NetwPkt* ProbabilisticBroadcast::encapsMsg(cPacket* message)
00285 {
00286   cPacket* msg = static_cast<cPacket*>(message);
00287   ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* pkt = new ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt(msg->getName(), DATA);
00288 //  ProbBcastNetwControlInfo* cInfo = dynamic_cast<ProbBcastNetwControlInfo*>(msg->removeControlInfo());
00289   cObject* cInfo = msg->removeControlInfo();
00290 
00291   ASSERT(cInfo);
00292   pkt->setByteLength(headerLength);
00293   pkt->setSrcAddr(myNetwAddr);
00294   pkt->setDestAddr(LAddress::L3BROADCAST);
00295   pkt->setInitialSrcAddr(myNetwAddr);
00296   pkt->setFinalDestAddr(LAddress::L3BROADCAST);
00297   pkt->setAppTtl(timeToLive);
00298   pkt->setId(getNextID());
00299 
00300   setDownControlInfo(pkt, LAddress::L2BROADCAST);
00301   //encapsulate the application packet
00302   pkt->encapsulate(msg);
00303 
00304   // clean-up
00305   delete cInfo;
00306 
00307   return pkt;
00308 }
00309 
00310 void ProbabilisticBroadcast::insertNewMessage(ProbabilisticBroadcastPkt* pkt, bool iAmInitialSender)
00311 {
00312   simtime_t ttl = pkt->getAppTtl();
00313 
00314   if (ttl > 0) {
00315     simtime_t bcastDelay;
00316     tMsgDesc* msgDesc;
00317 
00318     // insert packet in queue with delay in [0, min(TTL, broadcast period)].
00319     // since the insertion schedules the message for its first broadcast attempt,
00320     // we use a uniform random back-off taken between now and the broadcast delay
00321     // to avoid having all nodes in the neighborhood forward the packet at the same
00322     // time. Backoffs used at MAC layer are thought to be too short.
00323     if (broadcastPeriod < maxFirstBcastBackoff)
00324       bcastDelay = broadcastPeriod;
00325     else
00326       bcastDelay = maxFirstBcastBackoff;
00327     if (bcastDelay > ttl)
00328       bcastDelay = ttl;
00329     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " insertNewMessage(): insert packet " << pkt->getId() << " with delay "
00330        << bcastDelay << endl;
00331     // create container for message and initialize container's values.
00332     msgDesc = new tMsgDesc;
00333     msgDesc->pkt = pkt;
00334     msgDesc->nbBcast = 0;  // so far, pkt has been forwarded zero times.
00335     msgDesc->initialSend = iAmInitialSender;
00336     debugMsgIdSet.insert(pkt->getId());
00337     insertMessage(uniform(0, bcastDelay), msgDesc);
00338   }
00339   else {
00340     EV << "PBr: " << simTime() << " n"  << myNetwAddr << " insertNewMessage(): got new packet with TTL = 0." << endl;
00341     delete pkt;
00342   }
00343 }
00344 
00345 cPacket* ProbabilisticBroadcast::decapsMsg(NetwPkt *msg)
00346 {
00347   cPacket *m = msg->decapsulate();
00348   m->setControlInfo(new ProbBcastNetwControlInfo(msg->getSrcAddr()));
00349   // delete the network layer packet
00350   delete msg;
00351   return m;
00352 }
